item.title: Aukus: France pulls out of UK defence talks amid row
item.description: Paris is angry after Australia cancelled a submarine contract in favour of a deal with the UK and US.

item.title: Russia shooting: Gunman kills several at Perm University
item.description: The attacker is said to have walked on to the university campus on Monday morning and started shooting.

item.title: Aukus could trigger a 'nuclear arms race', says North Korea
item.description: Pyongyang said the pact would "upset the strategic balance in the Asia-Pacific region".

item.title: Endangered South African penguins killed by swarm of bees near Cape Town
item.description: More than 60 protected birds were found on the beach with multiple bee-stings but no other injuries.

item.title: Hotel Rwanda hero Paul Rusesabagina convicted on terror charges
item.description: A Rwandan court finds Paul Rusesabagina guilty of supporting a terrorist group.

item.title: Russia election: Putin's party heads for victory amid vote fraud claims
item.description: The pro-Kremlin United Russia party is on course for a majority in a parliamentary vote.

item.title: Canary Islands: Lava from erupting volcano destroys homes
item.description: The volcano on La Palma continues to spew lava after 5,000 were evacuated from villages in its path.

item.title: Gabby Petito: Body matching missing woman found in Wyoming
item.description: Crews searching for the missing Florida woman have found a body in a national park, the FBI says.

item.title: Migrants in Texas: US flies Haitian migrants back home from border
item.description: Hundreds of would-be immigrants camped under a bridge on the US-Mexico border are returned to Haiti.

item.title: Hong Kong sees patriots inducted into new election committee
item.description: Hong Kong had earlier passed a way designed to keep "unpatriotic" people from positions of power.

item.title: My husband and son fought in Afghanistan - it changed all of us
item.description: America's two decades in Afghanistan impacted those who served - and the families waiting at home.

item.title: Burundi floods: Lake Tanganyika's water levels rise
item.description: Heavy rains have caused water levels to rise, forcing about 100,000 people to flee, a charity says.

item.title: My dad, held hostage in Iran
item.description: London-based baker Elika Ashoori is campaigning to bring her father home from jail in Iran.

item.title: Giving birth under the Taliban
item.description: Pregnant women, new mothers and infants are bearing the brunt of a worsening healthcare crisis.

item.title: Canada election: What you need to know about the campaign
item.description: Canadians are voting on Monday and Justin Trudeau's party faces a stiff challenge to retain power.

item.title: South African whistle-blower: I don't feel safe
item.description: Mosilo Mothepu has paid a heavy price for speaking out about corruption in her firm.

item.title: US-UK-Australia pact delivers France some hard truths
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield assesses the harsh realities for France after Australia's US-UK deal.

item.title: Can apps manage our chronic health conditions?
item.description: A Swedish tech firm has created an app to help alleviate people's joint pain.

item.title: From Katrina to Ida: How US presidents react to climate change and natural disasters
item.description: Since Hurricane Katrina in 2005, US presidents have realised the impact of their reactions to extreme weather.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Volcano on Canary Island La Palma erupts, spewing ash and lava into national park
item.description: Video shows the volcano, on La Palma, spewing ash and lava in its first major eruption since 1971.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.

item.title: SpaceX: Inspiration4 amateur astronaut capsule splashes back to Earth
item.description: The quartet of civilian astronauts lands safely in the Atlantic off the coast of Florida.

item.title: ICYMI: Surfing dogs and Spain's 'ugliest tomato' contest
item.description: Dogs are making a splash in our round-up of the stories you may have missed this week.
